channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DHS shuts down after a funding lapse. And, why athletes get the 'yips' at the Olympics
item.description: Congress is out on recess as a partial shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is underway. And, why some superstar athletes have been getting the "yips" at the Winter Olympics in Italy.
item.content:encoded:
Congress is out on recess as a partial shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is underway. And, why some superstar athletes have been getting the "yips" at the Winter Olympics in Italy.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: One Olympic sport still excludes women. This week's viewing numbers could change that
item.description: Nordic combined is the only Olympic sport that doesn't allow women to compete, despite athletes' efforts to change that. They say their odds for 2030 hinge on people watching men's events this week.
item.content:encoded:
Nordic combined is the only Olympic sport that doesn't allow women to compete, despite athletes' efforts to change that. They say their odds for 2030 hinge on people watching men's events this week.

(Image credit: Barbara Gindl)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'American Struggle' author assesses Trump's expansion of presidential power
item.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jon Meacham talks about Trump's impact on democracy. Meacham's latest book is a collection of speeches, letters and other original texts from 1619 to the present.
item.content:encoded: Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jon Meacham talks about Trump's impact on democracy. Meacham's latest book is a collection of speeches, letters and other original texts from 1619 to the present.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: How to register to vote in the 2026 primaries
item.description: For the 2026 primary elections, NPR has collected deadlines and information on how to register to vote — online, in person or by mail — in every U.S. state and territory.
item.content:encoded: For the 2026 primary elections, NPR has collected deadlines and information on how to register to vote — online, in person or by mail — in every U.S. state and territory.
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Is that carb ultra-processed? Here's a test even a kid can do
item.description: The latest nutrition guidelines urge Americans to avoid highly-processed food. But, when it comes to carbs, many people don't know which ones are ultra-processed. Here's an easy way to find out.
item.content:encoded: The latest nutrition guidelines urge Americans to avoid highly-processed food. But, when it comes to carbs, many people don't know which ones are ultra-processed. Here's an easy way to find out.
item.dc:creator: Michaeleen Doucleff

item.title: U.S. Olympic speed skaters adapt NASCAR 'bump drafting,' revolutionizing team event
item.description: U.S. Team Pursuit speed skaters will top speeds of 30 mph by pushing themselves around the track mere inches from each other.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Team Pursuit speed skaters will top speeds of 30 mph by pushing themselves around the track mere inches from each other.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: Rolando Arrieta

item.title: Israel will begin contentious West Bank land registration
item.description: Israel will begin a contentious land regulation process in a large part of the occupied West Bank, which could result in Israel gaining control over wide swaths of the area for future development.
item.content:encoded:
Israel will begin a contentious land regulation process in a large part of the occupied West Bank, which could result in Israel gaining control over wide swaths of the area for future development.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: An Islamist party becomes Bangladesh's main opposition for the first time
item.description: An Islamist party has become Bangladesh's main opposition for the first time in the country's history, challenging the old dynastic political system despite persistent concerns among critics about the party's policies on women.
item.content:encoded:
An Islamist party has become Bangladesh's main opposition for the first time in the country's history, challenging the old dynastic political system despite persistent concerns among critics about the party's policies on women.

(Image credit: Sajjad Hussain)
item.dc:creator: Shamim Chowdhury

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Lawmakers no closer to a deal as partial government shutdown continues, officials to meet for more talks as Ukraine war nears 4th anniversary, what is it about Olympics that gives athletes "the yips"?
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers no closer to a deal as partial government shutdown continues, officials to meet for more talks as Ukraine war nears 4th anniversary, what is it about Olympics that gives athletes "the yips"?
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Michael Jordan, six-time NBA champion, is now a Daytona 500 winner
item.description: Tyler Reddick won "The Great American Race" on Sunday with a last-lap pass at Daytona International Speedway that sent Jordan into a frantic celebration.
item.content:encoded:
Tyler Reddick won "The Great American Race" on Sunday with a last-lap pass at Daytona International Speedway that sent Jordan into a frantic celebration.

(Image credit: Nigel Cook)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
